response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds for the operating and capital improvement costs of the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning on July 1, 2025, and ending on June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_40] This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [CHUNK_1] Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by inserting appropriate operating and capital improvement amounts for fiscal biennium 2025-2027 and changing the effective date to July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_42]",
  "appropriations": "This budget measure, as amended, appropriates general fund operating totals of $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_43] Of the general fund appropriation for administration (JUD601), the sum of $2,218,922 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) is for fiscal year 2025-2026 for salary adjustments as recommended by the commission on salaries. [CHUNK_14] The measure also appropriates capital improvement totals from general obligation bonds of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026. [CHUNK_44]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The sums appropriated are to accomplish the purposes and programs designated for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_5] The total expenditures and the number of permanent and temporary positions established in each fiscal year shall not exceed the sums and the position ceilings indicated. [CHUNK_6] The chief justice may transfer sufficient funds and positions between programs for operating purposes when the need arises. [CHUNK_10]",
  "agency_impact": "The judiciary is appropriated funds for its various programs, including the Courts of Appeal, the First, Second, Third, and Fifth Judicial Circuits, the Judicial Selection Commission, and Administration. [CHUNK_7, CHUNK_8, CHUNK_9] The chief justice may transfer funds between programs to implement any salary adjustments. [CHUNK_15] The judiciary may delegate the planning, acquisition of land, design, construction, and equipment of any capital improvement project to other state or county agencies when it is determined to be advantageous to do so. [CHUNK_24]",
  "economic_impact": "Appropriations support the operations of The Judicial System, a core function of state government. [CHUNK_6] The measure appropriates $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) for capital improvement projects such as general alterations, upgrades, and improvements to Judiciary facilities statewide, which will support economic activity. [CHUNK_16, CHUNK_19] A sum of $2,218,922 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) from the general fund appropriation for administration shall be expended for salary adjustments. [CHUNK_14]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure enacts the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [CHUNK_1] It provides the necessary funding for the operating and capital improvement costs of the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium. [CHUNK_40] The Act also authorizes the issuance of general obligation bonds to finance authorized capital improvement projects. [CHUNK_21]",
  "revenue_sources": "Funding sources specified in this Act include general funds (A), special funds (B), general obligation bond funds (C), and revolving funds (W). [CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3] General obligation bonds may be issued to yield the amount necessary to finance projects, provided that the sum total of the general obligation bonds so issued shall not exceed $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_21] The judiciary may also secure federal funds or funds from private organizations or individuals. [CHUNK_12]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "This Act appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_5] As amended, this budget measure appropriates general fund operating totals of $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_43] The total operating appropriations from all means of finance are $214,571,429 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $212,425,098 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_43] For capital improvements, the budget appropriates $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) in general obligation bonds for FY 2025-2026. [CHUNK_44] A specific appropriation of $2,218,922 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) from the general fund is designated for salary adjustments in FY 2025-2026. [CHUNK_14] The appropriations for capital improvement projects shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made. [CHUNK_22] All other appropriations for FY 2025-2026 and FY 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [CHUNK_23] These appropriations establish the baseline for future Judiciary budgets. [CHUNK_5]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The provided documents do not contain any information regarding impacts on operating revenues. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_37] The bill focuses on appropriations and expenditures for the Judiciary's operations and capital projects. [CHUNK_5, CHUNK_16]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The sum of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) is appropriated in part II for capital improvement projects. [CHUNK_15] These projects include the Kauai Judiciary Complex Chiller Replacement, Lump Sum CIP for Judiciary Facilities statewide, and the South Kohala District Courthouse. [CHUNK_18, CHUNK_19, CHUNK_20] The chief justice shall determine when and the manner in which the authorized capital improvement projects shall be initiated. [CHUNK_28]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The appropriations made for capital improvement projects will not lapse at the end of the fiscal year, allowing for long-term project completion. [CHUNK_22] All unrequired balances in the general obligation bond fund after project objectives have been met shall be transferred to the judiciary project adjustment fund. [CHUNK_25] All operating appropriations for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, will lapse. [CHUNK_23]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "General fund operating appropriations have been updated to $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_43] A new provision directs that $2,218,922 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) from the administration's general fund appropriation be expended for salary adjustments in FY 2025-2026, replacing previous language regarding civil and immigration legal services. [CHUNK_14] The effective date has been changed from a defective date of July 1, 2050, to July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_42, CHUNK_35]",
  "fte_positions": "The measure establishes the maximum number of permanent or temporary positions authorized for a particular program, referred to as the \"Position ceiling\". [CHUNK_3] For the fiscal biennium, position ceilings are set for each program within the Judicial System, such as 1,115.50 permanent positions for the First Judicial Circuit. [CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7] No new specific FTE positions are added in this version of the bill. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_37]",
  "appropriations_changes": "This version of the measure inserts the final appropriate operating and capital improvement amounts for fiscal biennium 2025-2027. [CHUNK_42] General fund operating totals are set at $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1_CCR157_.htm.txt) for FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_43] A new appropriation of $2,218,922 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt) is specified for salary adjustments. [CHUNK_14]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "The authorization for capital improvement projects remains funded by general obligation bond funds (MOF C) for a total not to exceed $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_21, CHUNK_44] Operating funds continue to be appropriated from general funds (MOF A), special funds (MOF B), and revolving funds (MOF W). [CHUNK_3, CHUNK_9] There are no changes to the methods of funding in this version of the bill. [CHUNK_2]",
  "department_impact": "All appropriations are made to the judiciary. [CHUNK_5] The bill contains a provision allowing the judiciary to delegate the planning and implementation of any capital improvement project to other state or county agencies if it is advantageous. [CHUNK_24] No other changes to departmental responsibilities are noted. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_37]",
  "reports_required": "If any manifest clerical, typographical, or other mechanical error is found in this Act, the chief justice may correct the error. [CHUNK_34] All changes made pursuant to this section shall be reported to the legislature at its next regular session. [CHUNK_35]",
  "pilot_program": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding any pilot programs. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_37] The previous fiscal note's references to the Women’s Court Pilot Project and DWI Court Program are not present in this version of the bill. [CHUNK_40] This measure focuses on the overall judiciary budget. [CHUNK_40]",
  "sunset_date": "All appropriations made for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [CHUNK_23] Appropriations for capital improvement projects authorized in this Act shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made. [CHUNK_22]",
  "effective_date": "This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_35] The Committee on Conference changed the effective date to July 1, 2025, from the previous defective date. [CHUNK_42]"
}

HAWAII: PART I. GENERAL PROVISIONS SECTION 1. This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. SECTION 2. Unless otherwise clear from the context, as used in this Act: "Means of Financing," or "MOF," means the source from which funds are appropriated, or

"MOF," means the source from which funds are appropriated, or authorized, as the case may be, to be expended for the programs and projects specified in this Act. the remainder of this Act and any provision thereof shall not be affected. If any portion of a specific appropriation is held to be invalid for any reason, the remaining portion shall be independent of the invalid portion and shall be expended to fulfill the objective and intent of the

overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fiscal note. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fiscal note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.
